cards.title: Data Gaps
cards.text: Smaller and unlisted companies are often left out of the existing data offering, shifting the burden of acquiring this data to the data consumers.

cards.title: Quality Issues
cards.text: Inaccurate, inconsistent, or outdated data jeopardizes the integrity of analytics and decision processes, leading to misguided strategies.

cards.title: Usage Restrictions
cards.text: Companies are quite limited in how they can use the data they acquired, hindering many valuable applications of this data.

cards.title: High Price
cards.text: Data is becoming more and more expensive, limiting access to essential information for many organizations.

cards.title: Search
cards.text: Utilize the search feature to find specific companies within the platform.

cards.title: Request company’s inclusion
cards.text: Request company’s inclusion in case you can’t find the company you are looking for.

cards.title: Request framework data
cards.text: Join a campaign to get the missing data.

cards.title: Download
cards.text: Download either through the platform or through API.

sections.title: Join a campaign
text: The campaigns are a simple way for you to get better data coverage and improved data quality, while testing Dataland.

cards.title: Pathways to Paris
cards.text: Captures companies’ progress on Paris-compatible transformation paths that are necessary to achieve the goals of the Paris climate protection agreement.

cards.title: LkSG
cards.text: The Lieferkettensorgfalts-pflichtengesetz is a German law requiring companies to monitor human rights and environmental risks in their supply chains.

cards.title: EU Taxonomy
cards.text: The EU Taxonomy Regulation supports companies to capture their environmentally sustainable economic activities.

cards.title: SFDR
cards.text: SFDR helps investors to properly assess how sustainability risks are integrated in the investment decision process.

cards.title: Your message
cards.text: Get in touch

cards.title: Inquiry about Dataland: Shortest way to fill data gaps and improve data quality
cards.text:
Hello Erik,
 
I recently visited Dataland and I'm interested in learning more about your platform, its features, and how I can get involved.

Could you please provide me with information regarding:
1.      The purpose and mission of your website.
2.      Key functionalities and features.
3.      The different frameworks
4.      How can I get data / provide data

If you have any upcoming events or newsletters, I'd love to know about those too.

Feel free to reply to this email or share the best way to get in touch.

Thank you, and I look forward to hearing from you.
Best regards,
